docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This is a sample for communication from a B&R PLC to a T-Panel over OPC UA. You can view change data as well as calling methods (functions). The sample consists of the package mappPanel and the corresponding mappView page. See the import page for details how to integrate the sample into your project.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
The sample was developed with Automation Studio 4.12 and panel firmware 1.7.0. but may also work with versions below that.

  • Automation Studio 4.12
  • Panel firmware 1.7.0

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
• Import the sample into your project. See the import page for details.
  • Open the file 'TPanel.var' from the package and change the IP address and type of the panel to match your panel.
  • Make sure that OPC UA server is activated on the panel service page.

docs.title: Danger Zone
docs.text:
Here are some parameter changes that will break the panel OPC UA connection.

  • Startup Mode: Service Page

docs.title: Connection is established but then error 2148466688 is returned from getting handle list
docs.text: This error can occur when the panel type is not set correct. Check the panel type in the panel settings.

docs.title: Connection is not established an error 2147811328 is returned from connecting to panel
docs.text: This error can occur when the OPC UA server on the panel is turned of. Make sure the OPC UA server is enabled in the panel settings.

docs.title: When I try to compile the sample I get the error "undefined reference to 'UaSrv_GetServerState"
docs.text:
This error occurs when you dont use the latest OpcUa library. If you can't update the library, you can use the following workaround:

Change the line 

IF (UaSrv_GetServerState() = UASS_Running) AND (PowerPanel.Diag.PingOk) AND (VariablesTotalIndex > 0) THEN

in

IF (PowerPanel.Diag.PingOk) AND (VariablesTotalIndex > 0) THEN

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The task uses the variable structure 'PowerPanel' to communicate with the outside world.

docs.title: Command structure
docs.text:
The structure PowerPanel looks as follows:

Level 1 Level 2 Level Description Command Trigger a command. The command is reset to false when the execution is finished. Connect Connect to the T-Panel. Disconnect Disconnect from the T-Panel. Write Write pending data. ResetError Reset errors. Data This structure contains alle the OPC UA data that is available from the panel. See the corresponding panel documentation for details. See appendix for a collection of links. Method This structure allows you to call methods (functions) on the connected panel. Type The function that is called on the panel. The method is called as soon as it is selected. See the corresponding panel documentation for more details on OPC UA methods. BuzzerDuration Parameter for method 'BuzzerWithPara'. BuzzerFrequency Parameter for method 'BuzzerWithPara'. ActualTime Parameter for method 'SetTime'. Brightness Parameter for method 'SetBrightness' and 'SetBrightnessUnlimited'. Parameter Structure with parameters. PanelIP Panel IP address. PanelType Use one of the following types: T30, T50, FT50, T80 Diag Structure with diagnostic information. PingOK Indicates that the IP from Parameter.PanelIP can be pinged. IsConnected Indicates that a connection was established. PendingWrites Indicates that at least one data point was changed. Call the write command to send the data back to panel. Step Current state machine step. StatusText Shows the state information as text or error information. StatusId Shows busy states or error number. VariableErrors List of the first 10 data points that could not be connected. VariableErrorsIndex Total number of data points that could not be connected. VisHelper... Variables to change visibility in mappView. ErrorStep State machine step where the error occurred.

docs.title: Error handling
docs.text:
The task generates the following list of error messages. All other error numbers are generated from included libraries that can be found in the Automation Studio help.

No Constant Text 10000 ERR_PANEL_NO_DATA_MODULE The data module with the corresponding OPC UA tags is missing 10001 ERR_PANEL_IP_EMPTY IP address was not set 10002 ERR_PANEL_PANEL_TYPE_EMPTY Panel type was not set 10003 ERR_PANEL_FIRST_READ First read timed out 10003 ERR_PANEL_CONNECTION_LOST Connection to panel was interrupted 10003 ERR_PANEL_METHOD_NOT_FOUND The method does not exist on the corresponding panel

docs.title: Data module
docs.text:
The task uses a data module that contains all the OPC UA variables that are connected. The data modules has the following structure:

Browsepath Variable/Argument Argument NameSpaceIndex Identifier Access /0: Objects/0: Server/0: ServerStatus/0: CurrentTime PowerPanel. Data. Time. CurrentDateTime "" 0x0000 "" "S"

Not all variables may exist on every panel. The variable PowerPanel. Diag. VariableErrors contains the first 10 variables that could not be connected. See appendix for more details.

docs.title: Calling methods
docs.text:
The following methods can be called on the panel:

  • AwakePanel
  • RestartSystem
  • StartRemoteAccess
  • StopRemoteAccess
  • SaveConfiguration
  • LoadConfiguration
  • StartUpdate
  • BuzzerDefault
  • BuzzerWithPara
  • SetBrightness
  • SetBrightnessUnlimited
  • SetTime

The method RestartSystem and StartUpdate automatically disconnect the connection. The connection must be re-established after the panel rebooted. Wait a few extra seconds after restart before reconnecting.

Important Note: The method is executed immediately when the type was changed and set back to 'NoMethod' when it was executed.

docs.title: Changing panel data
docs.text:
The sample allows you to change the data on the panel. The the panel manual on what data can be changed and what is read only. When parameters is changed it is not written until the command 'Write' is executed. The command 'Write' is reset to false when the execution is finished. The variable 'PowerPanel. Diag. PendingWrites' is set to true when at least one data point was changed. Many parameter changes require a restart of the panel to take affect. The following procedure is recommended:

  • Change the parameter
  • Call method 'SaveConfiguration'
  • Call method 'RestartSystem'

Important Note: Make sure that the parameter change does not break the connection after reboot. For example, changing the IP address may break the connection if the IP address is not set correctly. Changing the startup mode to 'ServiceMode' will also break the connection because the panel will not start the OPC UA server.

docs.title: Import
docs.text:
To import the project open your project and the sample project side by side. For this guide we assume that you already have mapView added to your project.

Copy and paste the package mappPanel from the sample into your project.

Copy and paste the mappView page mappPanel from the sample into your project. Add the page to your navigation page or add a button to navigate to the page.

  • Switch to the configuration view
  • Select your OPC UA configuration
  • Enable the variable 'PowerPanel'
  • Select 'Recursive without arrays' for the property 'Automatic Enable'

  • Expand the structure and select 'VariableErrors'
  • elect 'Recursive' for the property 'Automatic Enable'

Copy and paste the files contentTPanel.binding and contentTPanel.eventbinding into your mappView package under the configuration view.

  • Open the file 'Visualization.vis'
  • Add the page pageTPanel, the binding contentTPanel_binding and the event bindinging contentTPanel_eventbinding
